instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01814-A  H2O  PPVOUT_SO_Back light short to EDP_INT
threads.message:
I know the MUX is toast.....   Does this use the same chip as the 820-01841?  Is this MUX available?
The connector on the display board is also bad.   Is this replaceable or am I just buying a new display as well?

Dammit APPLE why did you put this next to this data line.   IDIOTS

threads.title: 820-01814-A  H2O  PPVOUT_SO_Back light short to EDP_INT
threads.message:
They are not idiots; they just found a good way to sell more new machines.
There is no warranty for liquid spill on that area.

Analog MUX shouldn't have firmware.
Just check if 01041 has the same code chip.

threads.title: 820-01814-A  H2O  PPVOUT_SO_Back light short to EDP_INT
threads.message: The chip on the board is a 6124E  and my replacements are a L6142

threads.title: 820-01814-A  H2O  PPVOUT_SO_Back light short to EDP_INT
threads.message: Just tried it.    It works just fine.   so they are interchangeable.
